title: Mount Bubier
text: Mount Bubier is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> visible from seaward, its summit about south of the northern tip of <a href="Edwards%20Peninsula">Edwards Peninsula</a> on <a href="Thurston%20Island">Thurston Island</a>. It was first delineated from air photos taken by <a href="U.S.%20Navy%20Operation%20Highjump">U.S. Navy Operation Highjump</a> in December 1946, and named by the <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> for <a href="Kennard%20F.%20Bubier">Kennard F. Bubier</a>, an aviation mechanic on the <a href="Byrd%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Byrd Antarctic Expedition</a> in 1928–30.
